course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Cultures and Values: Economic Development, Legal Justice, and Social Diversity
course.description: This course has defined “historical narrative as a perception” as the specific approach of humanities perspective to form the contents of the Intended Learning Outcomes (ILOs). By applying this historiographical approach, the course will base on the following four propositions: a) historical narratives matter in our perception (shaping how we understand our world and perceive what is going on in our surroundings); b) historical narratives vary; c) Historical narratives may create bias; and d) historical narratives may generate positive mindset. Within this framework, three basic values will be explored: Economic development, legal justice, and social diversity. The first value explores the mindset of market efficiency and marketism in the pursuit of self-interest and material well-being of society as well as related controversy. The second value examines the competing perceptions of justice in law and beliefs. The third value relates to the complexity in racial, gender, and cultural diversity in various historical contexts. Lectures will discuss various ideas and theories in relation to these values and provide historical examples to help students reflect on these values.

reviews.author: Mico
reviews.title: 輕鬆huma course
reviews.comment_content:
Economic development既部份主要講HSBC既歷史及其成功因素, 還有上海與香港的經濟關係及發展上的互利.
Legal Justice就講中國買辦在香港對中國企業對外貿易的影響.
Social Diversity係講日本的人及公司在香港的生活及發展等, 例如:Yaohan
以上的內容都係一啲historical fact, 同busi/econ野無太大關係.

Workshop要上足, 因為會計分. Workshop 對寫篇文都有啲用 主要教個結構同寫法, 內容上既野涉獵好少.

reviews.author: GIN.chui
reviews.comment_content:
Instructor would be providing information or ideas through the lecture which you need to included in the final essay. There would not be lecture video after the add drop period. Moreover, the powerpoint is quite brief (only useful for the Quiz) which means there's not much materials in it for your essay. So, it is very important to attend the lecture even though there's no attendance taken.

And for the tutorial, it teaches you to structure your essay in case you have forgotten what you have learnt in LANG1002/1003. The tutor would not comment on your content (once again, attend the lecture) but your gramma and organization. (you might found it extremely boring if you are a native speaker) Attendance is taken.
reviews.comment_teaching: You can fully understand the instructor as he has clear elaboration, detail explanation and speaks really really slowly. Have some coffee will do. I do think the lecturer and tutor are friendly at responding question.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% essay (It is graded by your tutor and lecturer)
Quiz 20% ( based on lecture and powerpoint)
Online Discussion 10% (on canvas)
Writing Workshop Classroom Activities 10%
Writing Workshop Online Activities 10%

If your essay is fully elaborated and well organized but did bad in your quiz, you would be expected a B range.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's not hard to write the essay but you need evidence. I highly recommend everyone to look over the reference book listed in the powerpoint and Canvas. It helps a lot.

There will be assignment(s) for every tutorial (there are 5 tutorials in total). 2 quiz in total.

I found the workload reasonable but still it depends.

reviews.author: Oscar Wong
reviews.title: Boring course!!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
Boring.  REALLY BORING.  Do not take this course unless you really have interests towards history.  Otherwise you will want to skip all the lessons throughout the semester.  
The courses talks about the history of China, Japan and Hong Kong.  Some are actually common sense so do not need to memorize them.  For the details, please memorize them if you want to score a good grade
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring.  Professor Lee reads the words from his powerpoint and his powerpoints are mainly words.  So again do not take this course unless you are interested in history.
reviews.comment_grading: Your grade depends on your final essay.  The essay counts 50% of the final grade.  The other 50% are attendance, online assignments and quiz, which everyone is about the same.  However, the score of the final essay is not released so I don't have much comments about grading.  Just follow the instructions from your tutor and put as much effort in the essay.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light for a 3 credit course.  All you need to do is to attend the 5 writing workshops throughout the semester and complete the 1000 words essay on time.  There are also some online discussions and online assignments, but those are just minor stuff.  There is no final exam. You can skip all the lectures if you want.

reviews.author: Cad
reviews.comment_content:
The course focused on three main topics, namely economic development, social diversity and legal justice in the history of HK.

HSBC, the banking industry, compradors, HK-SH, HK-Japan were the issues to be discussed in the lectures.

Students, who are familiar with the history of HK, shall find the content interesting and easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lee highlighted most of the key messages in every lecture and the details of each story had been provided in the supplementary readings.

In the writing workshops, both online and offline, various skills of writing arguments have been introduced and students shall find them useful when working on their own essays.

Prof. Lee, Winnie and Kin are patient to every inquiry.
reviews.comment_grading:
online discussion (10%) ?/10
writing workshop classroom activities (10%) 10/10
writing workshop online activities (10%) 10/10
Quiz 20% (~14.5/20)
Final essay 50% (?/50)

Grade: A

I think it's easy to score full in the writing workshop parts, just work hard and don't forget the deadline of each online task.

About the quizzes, the questions were a bit tricky, but not difficult generally; read the sup. readings once or twice and you shall be fine.

The most determinant parts are the online discussion and the final essay; please do the former one regularly if you want a good grade, and try your best to come up with a strong argument in the final essay after sufficient reading.
reviews.comment_workload:
one lecture per week
6 writing workshops
some short online tasks
online discussion
a draft essay
a final essay

It should be manageable to everyone.

reviews.comment_workload:
唔算大workload但一啲都唔輕鬆。
1. Online activities，隔個星期喺canvas做，睇完videos做quizzes，unlimited attempts，預你全取。
2. 5堂writing workshops，每堂50mins，計attendance，主要係教argumentative essay嘅structure同assist我哋寫final essay，輕鬆嘅。
3. 3次online discussions，每次有2條問題要address，寫完自己見解之後要覆其他人，個個都係500up咁打上去，非常time-consuming。
4. 2個quizzes，全mc，考lecture slides同readings，我2次都淨係睇咗lecture slides，第一次俾我survive到，第二次考得多readings就完全白撞。
5. Final essay (1000 words)，3題essay prompts揀1，throughout成個sem會有唔同嘅deadlines要我哋一段段咁交俾workshop instructor，叫做攤分咗workload，唔駛sem尾一次過chur篇文出嚟。每次instructor都會俾feedback，要跟住改，都學到嘢嘅。
